page.title: 09Tunnel System
page.content: A stone tunnel runs under a rough grazing field in the SW of the block and links onto a network in Welbeck. This tunnel runs from "Nerves" the main entrance to the tunnels at Welbeck Abbey,up to Tunnel End Lodge and on towards Worksop. It takes it's name from the large number of skylights along it's length. It was constructed in the mid-late 19th century by the Fifth Duke of Portland,who payed a large number of the local unemployed to build it simply to alleviate unemployment in the area. The 5th Duke wanted the tunnel built so that his carriage could leave the Welbeck Estates without being seen,because he was a recluse. At the end is Tunnel End Lodge where workers were housed. Also a gate keeper opened the gates at the end of the tunnel.
